contentrichtext.text: {{Cleanup|date=January 2012}}[[Image:Uzi hitman memorial in ramat gan.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Uzi Hitman memorial in [[Ramat Gan]]]] '''Uzi Hitman''' ([[Hebrew]]: עוזי חיטמן, June 9, 1952 – October 17, 2004) was an [[Israel]]i [[singer]], [[songwriter]], [[composer]] and [[television]] personality. ==Early life== Hitman was born in [[Givat Shmuel]] to holocaust-survivor parents. His father was a cantor and his mother was secular. He was raised in a pluralistic environment. He was given a guitar by his parents aged 11, and a piano by his grandmother when he turned 17.<ref name="JT"/> In the army he served as a combat soldier and later he joined an army band. ==Career== His career began in 1976, when he composed a popular melody for [[Adon Olam]].<ref>[http://www.jafi.org.il/JewishAgency/English/Jewish+Education/Compelling+Content/Eye+on+Israel/Gallery+of+People+%28Biographies%29/Uzi+Hitman.htm Uzi Hitman (1952-2004)] on the Jewish Agency website</ref> He became a popular Israeli artist during the 1980s and 1990s. He composed and wrote over 650 songs. His most famous songs include ''Noladati Lashalom'' (I Was Born for Peace), ''[[Ratziti Sheteda]]'' (I Wanted You to Know), ''Todah'' (Thank you), ''Mi yada' sh'kach yihiye'' (Who Knew It Would Be Like This) and ''[[Kan (song)|Kan]]'' (Here), which reached 3rd place during the 1991 [[Eurovision Song Contest]]. Hitman also appeared on the 1980s children's programmes ''[[Parpar Nehmad]]'' and ''[[Hopa Hei]]''. He died after a [[myocardial infarction|heart attack]] at the age of 52. He was buried at the [[Yarkon Cemetery]] near [[Tel Aviv]].<ref name="JT">[http://www.jewish-theatre.com/visitor/article_display.aspx?articleID=953 Grieving for Israeli music maker: Uzi Hitman 1952-2004]</ref> The City of [[Ramat Gan]] renamed ''Kikar Hashoshanim'' (Roses Square) in his neighborhood of residence to ''Kikar Hitman'' (Hitman Square). ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category}} * [http://uri.webpoint.co.il/uzi-Hitman/welcome.html Official site] {{he icon}} {{Authority control|VIAF=57923225}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Hitman, Uzi | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = June 9, 1952 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = October 17, 2004 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hitman, Uzi}} [[Category:Children's musicians]] [[Category:1952 births]] [[Category:2004 deaths]] [[Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction]] [[Category:Israeli Jews]] [[Category:Israeli composers]] [[Category:Israeli people of Polish descent]] [[Category:Children of Holocaust survivors]] [[Category:Israeli male singers]] [[Category:Israeli songwriters]] [[Category:Israeli television actors]] {{israel-singer-stub}} {{Israel-actor-stub}}
